SENT.plain: A modification of the Raji cell technique for the detection of circulating immune complexes is described
Raji lymphoid cells bind immune complexes via the C 3 receptor
Prior to incubation with the test serum it is necessary to block the IgG Fc receptor which would interfere with the assay

In the present modification the IgG Fc receptor is blocked with monoclonal IgG myeloma proteins thereby facilitating the detection of C 3 bound immune complexes with fluoresecein-conjugated anti-light chain serum
This modification is presently used in a survey of immune complexes in a number of autoimmune diseases
